channel.title: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database
channel.description:
[url='https://www.cinemablend.com/games/Steam-Database-Adds-Halo-2-Halo-3-Fez-KOF-XIII-DayZ-52155.html']Including the god damn Halo trilogy...[/url]
So yeah, your thoughts?
from a facepunch thread [quote] Here's a whole list La-Mulana The Splatters Octodad: Dadliest Catch Beta Duke Nukem 3D : Atomic Edition (Duke Nukem 3D+) Super House of Dead Ninjas Fez LucasArts Test App Fast and Furious 6 Lococycle Yogventures! Hardware Hardware (Demo) Dyad Cut the Rope Shadow Warrior Complete Hardware (VIP) Hardware (Internal) THE KING OF FIGHTERS XIII Retro/Grade Resident Evil: Revelations THE KING OF FIGHTERS 2002 UNLIMITED MATCH THE KING OF FIGHTERS '98 ULTIMATE MATCH Quantum Conundrum 2 Halo 3 Halo 2 Halo: Combat Evolved The Witness Angry Birds Space Angry Birds Seasons Second Life [/quote]

item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
xalener:

That’s how they handle LOD transitions. That’s not the draw distance.

Well then change every instance I mention draw distance to LOD scaling.

Whatever it is, it needs to be fixed before it’s ported.

item.title: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
mankyman6:

No, again it’s not the typical pixelation. Sets of pixels will disappear continuously the farther away you get until the object is gone.

That’s how they handle LOD transitions. That’s not the draw distance.

Read full topic

item.description:

Reach is definitely the worst offender, though.

item.title: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Crysis did the same strange pixelation pop-in thing, and I always wondered why because it was clearly visible. Not sure if it worked the same in Crysis 2 retail, but I remember noticing it in one of the CE3 techdemos:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T6a6tUIA7LA&feature=player_detailpage#t=101s

You can see the barrel on the dock further down “materialize” sort of, from a bunch of pixels, that’s what you mean right?

Read full topic

item.source: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database

item.title: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I know I have. They tend to ‘grain’ or ‘pixel’ in more so than ‘pop’. You could see pixels of the object begin to form and the closer you get the fuller the object gets, the farther away, the grainier it gets until it is gone.

I don’t mean the object gets pixelated in the usual sense. It’s almost like the object desolves pixel by pixel.

Also, the “long” draw-distance is more for the landscape and scenery, such as those aerial battles everywhere, rather than things that actually matter.

Read full topic
item.source: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database

item.title: Influx of unlikely games appear in steam database
item.dc:creator: MSKyuuni
item.description:
Yeah.
Nice idea, but shit, they underestimated severely. Even if we do eventually get Halo 3, I couldn’t imagine Halo 4 PC happening for years.

Something could happen when the 360 gets phased out though.
